name: Petal Book
metadata:
{"name": "Petal Book 1/30", "description": "b�budb� is the second micro poem from Petal Book, a three-part lieder cycle inspired by Louise GlC<ckb�s The Wild Iris. 

Taking GlC<ckb�s oracular, anthropomorphic voice as a point of entry, Ana MarC-a Caballero explores our relationship with mortality, with words, and with each other, in this series of pithy, cutting poems written in the language of flowers. 

b�stem,b� the first poem, was released and offered to Refraction Festival's REFRACT PASS holders.  "bud" debuted during Proof of People in New York on April 12/13, 2023. b�bouquet,b� the third poem, will be offered to collectors via a future Refraction event. 

Holders of all three poems will receive a fourth work as a gift. 

*

stem
 
because you cut 
me
 
now
you have 
 
to water 
me 

*

bud
 
like every spoken word
 
I, too, 
wager everything
on the ignition of dirt
and thenb�
 
spring

 *
 
bouquet
 
my limbs bound
as offering 
by string, or

your hand
 
flesh-colored blossoms
upon the marbled slab
of time
